main event: A bright light was observed moving in a straight line, estimated to be 300 feet off the ground.
interesting points: The object was brighter than the stars and moon., Observations were made visually only., The sighting lasted for approximately eight minutes., The object disappeared over the horizon., Conclusions about the object include that it was possibly an aircraft or meteor.
witness description: Civilian observers including Mr. William's wife and her mother-in-law and sister-in-law.
